name: Muslim Wellness Foundation
mission: Muslim Wellness Foundation (MWF) is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization dedicated to promoting healing and well-being in American Muslim communities through dialogue, education and training. The MWF approach to health is interdisciplinary, intergenerational, spiritually grounded, community based, and justice-oriented. From being the first Muslim organization in the country to offer Mental Health First Aid (MHFA) trainings to establishing the annual Black Muslim Psychology Conference (BMPC), MWF has been an outspoken leader in fostering visions for wellness and healing. Our programs demonstrate our keen awareness of the link between oppression, wellness and how communities heal, grow, thrive, and experience joy in the midst of it all. We will continue to lead the way in shifting the conversation on mental health, addiction and trauma - from one narrowly focused on stigma to a healing-centered model of collective well-being, faith, identity and belonging. Join us on this journey.
theoryOfChange: The MWF approach to health is interdisciplinary, intergenerational, spiritually grounded, community based, and justice-oriented, aiming to shift from stigma-focused models to healing-centered models of collective well-being.

strengths_deep_dive: Muslim Wellness Foundation demonstrates an extraordinary commitment to its programmatic goals by maintaining a <cite id="2">100.0% program expense ratio</cite>. This lean operational model ensures that contributions directly support initiatives like the <cite id="4">Black Muslim Psychology Conference</cite> and <cite id="3">Mental Health First Aid trainings</cite>. Furthermore, the organization has achieved a <cite id="2">49.6% 3-year revenue CAGR</cite>, indicating growing community support and expanding capacity to address mental health needs within the American Muslim community.
rich_narrative.summary: Muslim Wellness Foundation Inc is a specialized nonprofit organization dedicated to promoting healing and emotional well-being within the American Muslim community. The organization focuses on capacity building and education, delivering programs such as <cite id="3">Mental Health First Aid (MHFA) trainings</cite> and hosting the <cite id="4">Black Muslim Psychology Conference (BMPC)</cite>. Financially, the organization operates with a highly concentrated program focus, reporting <cite id="2">$223,205 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year. Operations are remarkably lean, with a <cite id="2">100.0% program expense ratio</cite> and exceptional fundraising efficiency, spending <cite id="1">$0.00 per $1 raised</cite>. The organization has seen significant recent growth, demonstrating a <cite id="2">49.6% 3-year revenue CAGR</cite>. However, donors should note that the charity operates with very limited financial reserves, holding only <cite id="1">0.2 months of working capital</cite>, and currently has a low data confidence profile due to limited public transparency and the absence of a full Charity Navigator rating.
